title: Decolonizing Curriculum Design Based on Real-Life Contexts: A Case Study in Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematics curricula and familiarity with pedagogical concepts
context.additional_context: Focused on reinterpreting mathematics education from a postcolonial perspective, characterized by cultural context integration through real-life problem solving

learning_goals: Learners can apply the core principles of decolonial instructional design to real-life mathematical problems
Learners can design measurement educational materials reflecting cultural contexts and improve them through peer assessment.
Learners can propose teaching strategies to mitigate educational inequality based on the Realistic Mathematics Education (RME) theory.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
